title: Commending Robert and Betty Sendzischew, recipients of the Young Leadership Award at the 59th Anniversary Banquet of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center on March 27, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending Robert and Betty Sendzischew upon the
occasion of their designation as the recipients of the Young  Leadership
Award at the 59th Anniversary Banquet of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center
on March 27, 2011

WHEREAS, The quality and character of life in the Empire State is great-
ly  enriched  by  the  faithful and generous service of those who devote
themselves to endeavors of family, faith and community; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
commend  individuals  of such magnanimous conduct and bearing who demon-
strate a deep and continuing  concern  for  others,  and  in  so  doing,
inspire others to do the same; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern and fully in accord with its long-
standing traditions, it is  the  intent  of  this  Legislative  Body  to
commend  Robert  and Betty Sendzischew upon the occasion of their desig-
nation as the recipients of the Young Leadership Award at the 59th Anni-
versary Banquet of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center, to be held at  Kings
Terrace in Brooklyn on Sunday, March 27, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Flatbush Park Jewish Center has grown from a storefront
congregation of 45 families to become one of  New  York  City's  leading
Orthodox  congregations;  it  has  evolved  into a true center of Jewish
communal life, serving the religious, educational and  social  needs  of
the young and old of Brooklyn's Mill Basin community; and
  WHEREAS,  Robert  Sendzischew was a member of the synagogue's Board of
Trustees before becoming its Treasurer, the capacity  in  which  he  now
ably  serves;  Betty  Sendzischew  is  a valued and active member of the
Sisterhood; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the course of their service to the  Flatbush  Park
Jewish  Center  and  their  community, Robert and Betty Sendzischew have
exhibited uncommon valor and wisdom; their  involvement  and  leadership
have been characterized by an impressive commitment, an unbridled enthu-
siasm, and an uncompromising standard of excellence in all their endeav-
ors; and
  WHEREAS,  Robert  and  Betty Sendzischew are sincerely devoted members
and leaders of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center and  their  community  as
well  as  generous  supporters of many worthy programs and causes at the
Center, in the community, and in Israel; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to extend its highest  commen-
dation  to Robert and Betty Sendzischew for their dedication and commit-
ment to their community and their heritage; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause in its deliberations to pay
tribute to Robert and Betty  Sendzischew  upon  the  occasion  of  their
designation  as the recipients of the Young Leadership Award at the 59th
Anniversary Banquet of the Flatbush Park  Jewish  Center  on  March  27,
2011; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Robert and Betty Sendzischew.
